categories.title: Block Tank: AI-Powered Crypto Pitch Show for ai16zdao

content.text: Block Tank is an AI-powered platform being built for ai16zdao, an AI-led investment DAO on daosdotfun. The platform transforms crypto project pitches into interactive episodes in a Shark Tank-style game show format.

The system works by having users submit pitches with details about their idea and themselves. The platform then creates AI characters and voices for the pitchers who interact with AI judges. Complete episode simulations are generated in 15-20 seconds and are playable in-browser for fast iteration.

Under the hood, Block Tank uses a modular and interoperable system for episode creation, allowing for easy asset swapping and different rendering pipelines. The current demo runs on PlayCanvas, with openness to exploring Unity and Unreal Engine implementations.

The platform aims to scale partnerships, treasury management, grants, and governance by integrating goals and resources into the show. This creates a mutually beneficial ecosystem where DAOs can access deal flow while projects gain exposure, feedback, and connections to capital.

## Features

- Added configuration for enabling/disabling Twitter post generation (PR #3219)
- Added suppress action ability to Twitter, Telegram, and Discord integrations (PRs #3286, #3285, #3284)
- Optimized quick-intel plugin template and added suppress initialization message capability (PR #3283)
- Added test setup and coverage for plugin-cronos (PR #3250) and plugin conflux (PR #3247)
- Added support for herotag use in plugin-multiversx (PR #3238)
- Added GitHub issues link to CONTRIBUTING.md file (PR #3268)

## Bug Fixes

- Removed duplicated dependencies (PR #3215)
- Implemented optimizations and fixes for quick-intel plugin (PR #3208)
- Fixed DenyLoginSubtask (PR #3278)
- Fixed spelling issues (PR #3271)
- Fixed typos and updated broken links in documentation (PRs #3270, #3269, #3240)
- Fixed PostgreSQL query by using only 'text' subfield name (PR #3264)
- Fixed "Dynamic require of 'http' is not supported" error (PR #3262)
- Fixed pnpm install (PR #3261)
- Added handling for invalid JSON (PR #3258)
- Fixed client-alexa (PR #3255)
- Updated vitest dependency to address security issues (PR #3254)
- Implemented RAG optimizations and fixes for context (PR #3248)

## Other Changes

- Removed unnecessary provider and transferred code (PR #3251)
- Merged develop branch into main (PR #3216)

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering various functionality problems and feature requests:

1. **UI and Formatting Issues**:
   - Issue #3245: Twitter post and reply formatting errors
   - Issue #3252: Bot repeatedly posting the same reply format message after each interaction

2. **Configuration and Model Issues**:
   - Issue #3233: Model configuration not loading properly from character files
   - Issue #3279: Action processing failing to work after cache/database reset

3. **Plugin and Integration Problems**:
   - Issue #3234: Problems with bridging and swapping tokens in the plugin-evm
   - Issue #3265: Request for a ccxt plugin availability
   - Issue #3282: Speech-to-text functionality in Discord

4. **Technical and Environment Errors**:
   - Issue #3239: Docker errors specifically on Mac M1 hardware
   - Issue #3292: PNPM recursive run failures with exit code 7

These issues highlight ongoing development challenges across the platform's user interface, core functionality, plugin ecosystem, and deployment environments.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository focusing on Twitter integration, TON blockchain functionality, and general maintenance.

Twitter-related changes include tweet cleanup (PR #3237), disabling post functionality (PR #3222), and implementing a Twitter proxy URL (PR #3242).

TON blockchain development is progressing with multiple PRs: a lend/borrow TON plugin release (PR #3287), DEX provider interface implementation using DeDust SDK (PR #3273), and work-in-progress support for Liquidity Pool Management (PR #3253).

Maintenance PRs include merging develop branch to main (PR #3216), fixing Docker and types issues (PR #3220), and updating the vitest dependency to address security concerns (PR #3256).

Over a two-day period (February 4-6, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository showed significant development activity. The project had a total of 58 new pull requests, with 25 successfully merged. There were also 17 new issues created during this timeframe. The contributor base remained stable with 50 active contributors throughout the period. The second day (Feb 5-6) showed higher PR merge activity with 22 merges compared to only 3 merges on the first day.
sources: From 2025-02-04 to 2025-02-05, elizaos/eliza had 26 new PRs (3 merged), 11 new issues, and 50 active contributors.
From 2025-02-05 to 2025-02-06, elizaos/eliza had 32 new PRs (22 merged), 6 new issues, and 50 active contributors.
